Message.Title: Purge configuration not valid.
Message.Description: The Purge Time Key on Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) X19 is not valid.
Message.Consequences: Default time (300s) is used.
Message.Causes: Faulty or missing Purge Time Key.
Message.Actions:
1. Check that the Purge Time Key is correctly mounted.
2. Replace Purge Time Key.

Message.Title: Purge timers differ
Message.Description: Unacceptable divergence between CPLD and FPGA firmware on Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) purge timers.
Message.Consequences: The purge timer will be restarted.
Message.Actions: Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Divergence between PIB and MIB outputs
Message.Description: Process Interface Board (PIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) are not agreed concerned to output status for purge relay and power relay.
Message.Consequences: Purge sequence is restarted.

Message.Title: Glitch in purge system
Message.Description: Purge fault reported from Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) . The Purging system has detected pressure not OK from sensors. Motors and Paint Equipments are switched off and Main Computer may be informed to disconnect the Serial Measurement Unit (SMU). Depends on signal timing.
Message.Consequences: Motors and Paint Equipments are turned off, run chain opened and maybe also disconnected SMU.
Message.Actions:
1. Check air supply.
2. Check that air outlet is not blocked.
3. Check purge sensors and cabling for purge sensors.

Message.Title: Temp. too high, sensor
Message.Description: System overheat detected on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB) . Sensors 1-7: motor 1-7. Sensor 8: Serial measurement board. Run chain has been opened.
Message.Actions: Wait until the overheated motor or equipment has cooled down.

Message.Title: Activate connection error
Message.Description: Could not activate . Connection relay input indicates no connection.
Message.Actions:
1. Check that if mechanical unit is connected.
2. Check the connection relay input signal setup.

Message.Title: Brake power fault
Message.Description: The supervision of brake power on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB) has detected fault on the power signal and turned ON all brakes.
Message.Actions:
1. Check brake power on MCOB.
2. Check brake power relay in cabinet.
3. Check for disturbances on the brake power signal on MCOB.
4. Check for short circuit on brakes.

Message.Title: Brake power fault
Message.Description: The supervision of brake power on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB/MCB) has detected fault on the power signal and turned ON all brakes.
Message.Actions:
1. Check brake power on MCOB/MCB.
2. Check brake power from power supply in cabinet.
3. Check for disturbances on the brake power signal on MCOB/MCB.
4. Check for short circuit on brakes.

Message.Title: Brake short circuit fault
Message.Description: The supervision of brakes on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB/MCB) has detected a short circuit on axis and turned ON all brakes.
Message.Actions: 1. Check for short circuit on brakes.

Message.Title: Brake open circuit fault
Message.Description: The supervision of brakes on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB/MCB) has detected an open circuit on axis and turned ON all brakes.
Message.Actions: 1. Check for open circuit on brakes.

Message.Title: Temp. too high, sensor
Message.Description:
System overheat detected on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB/MCB) . Sensors supervised on motors, Serial measurement unit (SMU) or process equipment. Run chain has been opened.
Sensors 1-8: Robot motors 1-8. Sensor 9: SMU. Sensors 10-14: Process 1-5. Please refer to current robot configuration for more details.
Message.Actions: Wait until the overheated motor or equipment has cooled down.

Message.Title: I/O node flash disk error
Message.Description:
Flash name:
Flash disk function:
Error description:
Message.Actions: Report error.

Message.Title: Brake Failure
Message.Description: The brakes for mechanical unit fail to engage.
Message.Consequences: The mechanical unit may collapse when the motors are turned off.
Message.Causes: The configuration of brake relay may be incorrect, or the brake relay may be faulty If an external brake relay is being used, the relay must be correctly defined in the Motion configuration file.
Message.Actions:
1) Check that the external brake relay (if used) is correctly defined in the configuration file.
2) Check that the corresponding I/O signal is correctly defined in the I/O configuration file. How to check the configuration files is detailed in the Trouble Shooting Manual.

Message.Title: Power supply warning, faulty 24V COOL level
Message.Description: The 24V COOL output of the Control Module Power Supply is out of range.
Message.Consequences: No system consequence.
Message.Causes: The Control Module Power Supply unit cabling or the output load may cause the faulty voltage level. The power supplies are shown in the Trouble Shooting Manual and the Circuit Diagram!
Message.Actions:
1) Check all cabling to the Control Module Power Supply unit.
2) Check the output voltage level, and replace any faulty unit if required.

Message.Title: Power supply warning, faulty 24V SYS level
Message.Description: The 24V SYS output of the Control Module Power Supply is out of range.
Message.Consequences: No system consequence.
Message.Causes: The Control Module Power Supply unit, cabling or the output load may cause the faulty voltage level. The power supplies are shown in the Trouble Shooting Manual and the Circuit Diagram!
Message.Actions:
1) Check all cabling to the Control Module Power Supply unit.
2) Check the output voltage level, and replace any faulty unit if required.

Message.Title: There is no backup voltage available!
Message.Description: The backup energy bank maintaining the backup voltage is not functional.
Message.Consequences: After switching the power off, a B type restart must be performed. No system data changes will be saved at power off.
Message.Causes: This may be caused by a faulty backup energy bank, cabling or charger.
Message.Actions:
Before working on the system, perform a controlled shutdown to ensure all system data is correctly saved.
1) Check the cables and connectors of the backup energy bank.
2) Check the backup energy bank.
3) Check the power supply.
4) Replace the faulty unit if required.

Message.Title: Regained communication with Power Supply
Message.Description: The main computer has regained communication with the Control Module Power Supply.

Message.Title: Low backup energy bank voltage level
Message.Description: The voltage in the computer unit backup energy bank is too low to be functional.
Message.Consequences: No system consequence. No system data changes will be saved at power off.
Message.Causes: This may be caused by a faulty backup energy bank, cabling or charger.
Message.Actions:
Before working on the system, perform a controlled shutdown to ensure all system data is correctly saved.
1) Check the cables and connectors of the backup energy bank.
2) Check the backup energy bank.
3) Check the power supply.
4) Replace the faulty unit if required.

Message.Title: Faulty backup energy bank
Message.Description: The backup energy bank in the Control Module maintaining the backup voltage is not functional.
Message.Consequences: If switching the power off, a B type restart must be performed. No backup will be made at power off.
Message.Causes: This may be caused by a faulty backup energy bank, cabling or charger.
Message.Actions:
Before working on the system, perform a controlled shutdown to ensure all system data is correctly saved.
1) Check the backup energy bank cable and connector.
2) Check the backup energy bank.
3) Replace the faulty unit if required.

Message.Title: Lost communication: Power Supply and Computer
Message.Description: The main computer has lost communication with the Control Module Power Supply.
Message.Consequences: The main computer cannot retrieve status info or switch the power supply off. No system data changes will be saved at power off.
Message.Causes: The USB cable from the main computer to the Control Module Power Supply may be faulty or disconnected, or the power supply may be faulty.
Message.Actions:
Before working on the system, perform a controlled shutdown to ensure all system data is correctly saved.
1) Check the cabling and connectors to the Control Module Power Supply.
2) Check the power supply unit, and replace any faulty unit if required.

Message.Title: Power fault: Emergency Stop supply
Message.Description: Power fault on 24V Emergency Stop supply. Feedback from Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check power supply.

Message.Title: Power fault: 24V Failsafe supply
Message.Description: Power fault on 24V Failsafe supply. Feedback from Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check power supply.

Message.Title: Power fault: 24V I/O supply
Message.Description: Power fault on 24V I/O supply. Feedback from Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check power supply.

Message.Title: Power fault: 24V SYS supply
Message.Description: Power fault reported when 24V SYS < 18V. Feedback from Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) .
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check power supply.

Message.Title: Power fault: 24V I/O supply
Message.Description: Power fault reported when 24V I/O < 18V. Feedback from Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) .
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check power supply.

Message.Title: Power fault: 12V Purge supply
Message.Description: Power fault reported when 12V Purge < 10.8V. Feedback from Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) .
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check power supply.

Message.Title: Power fault: 12V TPU supply
Message.Description: Power fault on 12V Teach Pendant Unit (TPU) supply. Feedback from Pendant Interface Board (TIB).
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check power supply.

Message.Title: Battery charge low.
Message.Description: Less than 2 months until the battery backup to Serial Measurement Board (SMB) is discharged. Counting from first time this message was displayed. The battery is mounted on Manipulator Interface Board (MIB).
Message.Actions: Replace battery mounted on MIB.

Message.Title: Overtemperature in transformer
Message.Description: The temperature in the transformer is too high.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: The unit may be overloaded, its fans may be malfunctioning or the air flow may be restricted.
Message.Actions:
1) Make sure the fans are operating.
2) Check that air flow to the unit fans is not restricted.

Message.Title: Overtemperature in cabinet
Message.Description: The temperature in the cabinet is too high.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: The unit may be overloaded, its fans may be malfunctioning or the air flow may be restricted.
Message.Actions:
1) Make sure the fans are operating.
2) Check that air flow to the unit fans is not restricted.

Message.Title: Fault on contactor KM1
Message.Description: A fault is observed on motor contactor KM1.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check contactor.

Message.Title: Fault on contactor KM2
Message.Description: A fault is observed on motor contactor KM2.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check contactor.

Message.Title: Fault on contactor KM101
Message.Description: A fault is observed on motor contactor KM101.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check contactor.

Message.Title: Fault on contactor KM102
Message.Description: A fault is observed on motor contactor KM102.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Check contactor.

Message.Title: Run chain 1 feedback conflict
Message.Description: Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) reports divergence on Run chain 1 feedback signals.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.
3. Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Run chain 2 feedback conflict
Message.Description: Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) reports divergence on Run chain 2 feedback signals.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.
3. Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Brake chain 1 feedback conflict
Message.Description: Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) reports divergence on Brake chain 1 feedback signals.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.
3. Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Brake chain 2 feedback conflict
Message.Description: Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) reports divergence on Brake chain 2 feedback signals.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.
3. Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Cabin Interlock chain 1 feedback conflict
Message.Description: Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) reports divergence on Cabin Interlock chain 1 feedback signals.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.
3. Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Cabin Interlock chain 2 feedback conflict
Message.Description: Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) reports divergence on Cabin Interlock chain 2 feedback signals.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.
3. Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: HV Interlock chain 1 feedback conflict
Message.Description: Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) reports divergence on High Voltage (HV) Interlock chain 1 feedback signals.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.
3. Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: HV Interlock chain 2 feedback conflict
Message.Description: Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) reports divergence on High Voltage (HV) Interlock chain 2 feedback signals.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.
3. Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: System 2 Interlock chain feedback conflict
Message.Description: Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) reports divergence on System 2 Interlock chain feedback signals.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.
3. Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Main relay chain feedback conflict
Message.Description: Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) reports divergence on Main relay chain feedback signals.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.
3. Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Cabin Interlock chain 1 conflict
Message.Description: Divergence on Cabin Interlock chain 1 between input and output signals on Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Cabin Interlock chain 2 conflict
Message.Description: Divergence on Cabin Interlock chain 2 between input and output signals on Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.

Message.Title: HV Interlock chain 1 conflict
Message.Description: Divergence on High Voltage (HV) Interlock chain 1 between input and output signals on Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.

Message.Title: HV Interlock chain 2 conflict
Message.Description: Divergence on High Voltage (HV) Interlock chain 2 between input and output signals on Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Cabin Interlock chain conflict from SIB
Message.Description: Only one of the two Cabin Interlock chains is opened. Reported from Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Replace SIB if faulty.

Message.Title: HV Interlock chain conflict from SIB
Message.Description: Only one of the two High Voltage (HV) Interlock chains is opened. Reported from Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Replace SIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Brake Performance Warning
Message.Description: The Cyclic Brake Check indicates that the brake for the mechanical unit axis no has not full braking torque.
Message.Consequences: This is only a warning and no immediate action need to be taken.

Message.Title: Brake Performance Error
Message.Description:
The Cyclic Brake Check has found that the brake for the mechanical unit axis no has too low braking torque.
This brake will not be approved by the Safety Controller for Drive Module no .
Message.Consequences:
WARNING: The brake performance is too low for this axis.
Until the brake has approved braking torque, it is only possible to move the robot with the specified "Reduced max speed (mm/s)" according to the setup in the Configurator for Cylic Brake Check.
Message.Actions:
1) Run the Cycle Brake Check once more.
2) Exchange the motor with its brake.

Message.Title: Cyclic Brake Check Configuration Error
Message.Description: The Cyclic Brake Check has found that the brake for the mechanical unit axis no has no defined brake torque requirement level.
Message.Consequences: The Cyclic Brake Check will continue but no valid brake check will be done for this axis.
Message.Causes: The Motion configuration data are not correct specified for this axis.
Message.Actions:
The Motion configuration data are not correct specified for this axis:
1) Specify a value for parameter max_static_arm_torque if axis shell be tested.
2) Deactivate Cyclic Brake Check in Motion configuration if axis not to be tested.

Message.Title: Cyclic Brake Check Configuration Error
Message.Description: The Cyclic Brake Check has found that the brake for the mechanical unit axis no should be tested according to the configuration. But the actual mechanical unit can not be included in the Safety Controller, because activation/deactivation at runtime is allowed.
Message.Consequences: The Cyclic Brake Check will continue with other mechanical units.
Message.Causes: The Motion configuration data are not correct specified for this axis.
Message.Actions:
The Motion configuration data are not correct specified for this axis:
1) Cyclic Brake Check has been specified but should not be done for this axis
2) The mechanical unit must be active at startup and deactivation must not be allowed

Message.Title: Cabin Interlock chain conflict from MIB
Message.Description: Only one of the two cabin interlock chains is opened. Reported from Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) .
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: HV Interlock chain conflict from MIB
Message.Description: Only one of the two High Voltage (HV) chains is opened. Reported from Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) .
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Run chain conflict from SIB
Message.Description: Only one of the two run chain feedback signals from Safety Interface Board (SIB) was opened.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Replace SIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Brake chain conflict from SIB
Message.Description: Only one of the two brake chain signals from Safety Interface Board (SIB) was opened.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Replace SIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Run chain conflict from MIB
Message.Description: Only one of the two run chain feedback signals from Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) was opened.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Brake chain conflict from MIB
Message.Description: Only one of the two brake chain feedback signals from Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) was opened.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Replace MIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Emergency Stop relay conflict
Message.Description: Only one of the two Emergency Stop chains was opened internal on Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: The system remains in the Emergency Stop status.
Message.Actions:
1. Press emergency stop and reset emergency stop once again.
2. Replace SIB if faulty.

Message.Title: Circulation Fan malfunction
Message.Description: Circulation fan for the drive systems at the cabinet rear side has stopped or is rotating very slowly.
Message.Consequences: The drive systems temperature will rise.
Message.Causes: Faulty fan, cabling or power supply. See the Circuit Diagram!
Message.Actions:
1. Check the fan cables.
2. Check the power supply.
3. Check the fan.

Message.Title: Circulation Fan malfunction
Message.Description: Circulation fan in the cabinet front door has stopped or is rotating very slowly.
Message.Consequences: The temperature in the cabinet will rise.
Message.Causes: Faulty fan, cabling or power supply. See the Circuit Diagram!
Message.Actions:
1. Check the fan cables.
2. Check the power supply.
3. Check the fan.

Message.Title: Glitch in Emergency Stop circuits
Message.Description: Two or several status changes detected on signal within few milliseconds. This message is most likely caused by bad connections in ES_INPUT circuits.
Message.Consequences: Motors and Paint Equipments are maybe switched off.
Message.Actions: Check cables and connections on the safety system for ES_INPUT.
